alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 8:41PM EDT until March 31 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...SOUTH CENTRAL HOWARD...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY...NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGES...NORTHERN ARLINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN FAIRFAX COUNTIES...THE NORTHEASTERN CITY OF FAIRFAX AND THE CITY OF FALLS CHURCH... At 840 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mclean, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Bethesda, College Park, Greenbelt, Fairfax, Langley Park, Beltsville, Vienna, Falls Church, Bladensburg, Mantua, Pimmit Hills, Mclean, Fedex Field, American Legion Bridge, Fort Totten, Rosslyn, University of Maryland, Howard University and Gallaudet University. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
